snippet: With exports dropping, China and other Asian nations should stimulate domestic demand.
abstract: Editorial contends that slowed growth in exports from Asia since the financial crisis may be good news; calls on leaders of Asian countries like China and Japan to carry out policies that will stimulate domestic demand and make their economies less vulnerable to economic weakness in rest of the world.
lead_paragraph: With exports dropping, China and other Asian nations should stimulate domestic demand.

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations
